excerpt: Massive indoor/outdoor market with stalls selling fruits, veggies, cheese, meats & prepared dishes.
detail_description: Riga Central Market is a sprawling market located by the river, featuring both indoor and outdoor stalls offering a wide variety of goods. The market is housed in five historic buildings that were originally Zeppelin hangars, with each building specializing in different products such as fruits and vegetables, fish, meats, and more. The unique architecture of the market adds to its charm, with its metalwork dating back to the 1920s.
name: Riga Central Market
address: Nēģu iela 7, Latgales priekšpilsēta, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: 42m statue dedicated to Latvians who lost their lives fighting for independence between 1918 & 1920.
detail_description: The Freedom Monument, a 42-meter statue located in the city center of Riga's Old Town on Freedom Boulevard, is a striking landmark that pays tribute to Latvians who fought for independence between 1918 and 1920. Unveiled in 1935, this beautiful monument features a granite base with sculptures and bas-relief, a 19-meter travertine column, and a copper figure of Liberty holding aloft three gilded stars.
name: The Freedom Monument
address: Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Imposing medieval church, dating from the 15th century, with a distinctive, 123m-high steeple.
detail_description: St. Peter's Church is a medieval church with a remarkable 123-meter-high steeple, dating back to the 15th century. The main attraction here is the Clock Tower, offering a breathtaking panoramic view of Riga's cityscape and the charming red roofs of the Old Town. Despite its troubled history and multiple renovations, it stands tall as an iconic landmark in Riga. Visitors can enjoy various tours, including a popular walking tour that showcases the city's rich history and culture.
name: St. Peter's Church
address: Reformācijas Laukums 1, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Gothic-style property built in 1334, with medieval cellars & a presidential silver collection.
detail_description: The House of the Black Heads, a Gothic-style property constructed in 1334, showcases medieval cellars and a remarkable presidential silver collection. Despite being bombed during World War II, the building's architectural splendor was restored in the 1990s. Its Dutch Renaissance-inspired appearance features vibrant colors and exquisite ornamentation. The adjacent municipal square was built concurrently with the palace. Visitors can admire its stunning facade and explore museum exhibits and a re-created grand conference hall inside.
name: House of the Black Heads
address: Rātslaukums 7, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: National museum of art housed in an imposing building with a Baroque & classicist-style facade.
detail_description: The Latvian National Museum of Art stands as a magnificent testament to the country's rich artistic heritage, housed in an impressive neo-Classical building that dates back to 1905. With its stunning Baroque and classicist facade, this museum is a must-visit for anyone eager to delve into Latvia's classical art scene. The museum offers a fascinating glimpse into the nation's history through its diverse collections, showcasing how Latvia has perceived itself and interacted with other cultures over time.
name: Latvian National Museum of Art
address: Jaņa Rozentāla laukums 1, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1010, Latvia

excerpt: Iconic trio of dwellings from the medieval era, also the site of the Latvian Museum of Architecture.
detail_description: The Three Brothers, located on Maza Pils street in Old Riga, is a trio of iconic medieval dwellings that form the city's oldest complex of houses. These buildings now house the Latvian Museum of Architecture and showcase different architectural styles from various periods. The oldest building, dating back to the 15th century, features Gothic and Renaissance elements, while its neighboring house displays Dutch Mannerist influence. The third house exemplifies Baroque architecture from the 17th century.
name: Three Brothers, Latvian Museum of Architecture
address: Mazā Pils iela 19, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Educational space focused on the history of the occupation, plus archives & temporary exhibits.
detail_description: The Museum of the Occupation of Latvia is a historical institution dedicated to educating visitors about the period when Latvia was occupied by the USSR and Nazi Germany. With over 60,000 exhibits and an extensive audiovisual archive featuring more than 2,300 video testimonials, the museum provides a comprehensive overview of Latvia's history during this tumultuous time. It aims to remember and commemorate those who suffered unjustly during the occupations, including deportees, refugees, and those who were convicted or murdered.
name: Museum of the Occupation of Latvia
address: Latviešu strēlnieku laukums 1, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Outdoor museum in a forest with reconstructed houses & interiors from the 17th to 20th centuries.
detail_description: The Ethnographic Open-Air Museum of Latvia, located just a short distance from Riga's city center, is a vast outdoor museum set in a forest by Lake Jugla. It boasts an impressive collection of 118 well-preserved historical buildings dating from the 17th to the 20th centuries, representing all four provinces of Latvia. Visitors can explore traditional farmsteads, homes of farmers and craftsmen, and even witness folk artisans demonstrating their crafts during the summer months.
name: The Ethnographic Open-Air Museum of Latvia
address: Brīvdabas iela 21, Rīga, LV-1024, Latvia

excerpt: 19th-century, neo-classical theater & home to the national opera & ballet companies.
detail_description: The Latvian National Opera and Ballet, a 19th-century neo-classical theater, is home to the national opera and ballet companies. It transcends language barriers in its performances, making it an ideal destination for cultural enthusiasts. The institution has nurtured internationally acclaimed talents such as Sonora Vaice, Elina Garanca, and Andris Nelson. Collaborations with renowned soloists and directors result in exceptional opera and ballet productions.
name: Latvian National Opera
address: Aspazijas bulvāris 3, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Orthodox cathedral dating to the 19th century with golden domes & ornate interior architecture.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Riga, the Riga Nativity of Christ Orthodox Cathedral stands as a magnificent testament to 19th-century architecture. With its striking golden domes and intricate interior design, this cathedral is not only the largest Orthodox church in Latvia but also a symbol of resilience.
name: Riga Nativity of Christ Orthodox Cathedral
address: Brīvības bulvāris 23, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Riga, Latvia’s capital, is set on the Baltic Sea at the mouth of the River Daugava. It's considered a cultural center and is home to many museums and concert halls. The city is also known for its wooden buildings, art nouveau architecture and medieval Old Town. The pedestrian-only Old Town has many shops and restaurants and is home to busy Livu Square, with bars and nightclubs.
detail_description: Riga, the capital of Latvia, is a vibrant cultural center situated at the mouth of the River Daugava on the Baltic Sea. The city boasts an impressive array of museums, concert halls, and historical monuments. Its charming Old Town features medieval architecture alongside stunning art nouveau buildings and wooden structures. Visitors can explore pedestrian-only streets lined with shops and restaurants in this bustling area.
name: Riga
address: Latvia

excerpt: Founded in 1989, this spacious museum houses a collection of antique automobiles, plus a cafe.
detail_description: The Riga Motor Museum, established in 1989, is a spacious facility that showcases a remarkable collection of vintage automobiles and motorcycles. It holds the distinction of being the sole car museum in the former USSR and has earned recognition as one of Europe's top five technical museums. Visitors can explore over a hundred unique vehicles, including early 20th-century models, sports cars, war vehicles, and even limousines used by prominent figures like Breznev and Molotov.
name: Riga Motor Museum
address: Sergeja Eizenšteina iela 8, Vidzemes priekšpilsēta, Rīga, LV-1079, Latvia

excerpt: Striking riverside building with exhibitions on Latvian literature, guided tours & a viewing deck.
detail_description: The National Library of Latvia, also known as the Castle of Light, is a remarkable riverside building that offers exhibitions on Latvian literature, guided tours, and a viewing deck with a fantastic panorama of Riga. The library hosts various events and activities for visitors of all ages to foster a love for literature.
name: National Library of Latvia
address: Mūkusalas iela 3, Zemgales priekšpilsēta, Rīga, LV-1423, Latvia

excerpt: Medieval Lutheran church with Romanesque, early Gothic & Baroque architectural features.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Old Town, Riga Cathedral stands as a magnificent testament to centuries of architectural evolution. This medieval Lutheran church, constructed in the 13th century, showcases an impressive blend of Romanesque, early Gothic, and Baroque styles. As the largest medieval church in the Baltic States, it serves not only as a place of worship but also as a vibrant concert venue featuring its remarkable 19th-century pipe organ.
name: Riga Cathedral
address: Herdera laukums 6, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Restored Neo-Classical Medieval castle with grand presidential apartments & a history museum.
detail_description: Riga Castle, also known as Rigas pils, is a restored Neo-Classical Medieval castle that serves as the official residence and offices of the President of Latvia. It houses two museums and has a rich history dating back to the 14th century. While parts of the castle are off-limits due to security reasons, visitors can explore its tourist-friendly areas and learn about Riga's beginnings.
name: Riga Castle
address: Pils laukums 3, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Visitors can tour this historic apartment with art nouveau architecture, art & furnishings.
detail_description: The Riga Art Nouveau Center, also known as Rigas Jugendstila Centrs, offers a unique experience to explore the historical heritage of Art Nouveau in an authentic environment. Housed in a building from 1912 that was once used as KGB headquarters, the museum showcases the fruits of this art movement through a recreated early-1900s interior. Visitors can admire art nouveau architecture, art, and furnishings while gaining insight into the significance of Riga during the Russian Empire.
name: Riga Art Nouveau Center, museum
address: Alberta iela 12, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1010, Latvia

excerpt: Preserved mansion with an elaborate facade, part of a famed collection of art nouveau architecture.
detail_description: Riga, the capital city of a Baltic country in Northern Europe, is renowned for its stunning Art Nouveau architecture. The city boasts the highest concentration of Art Nouveau buildings globally, with many dating back to 1904-1910. Alberta Street is a must-visit, offering an array of exquisitely detailed structures. While some buildings may be undergoing restoration work, they still showcase the grandeur and intricacy of this architectural style.
name: Art Nouveau building
address: Alberta iela 12, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1010, Latvia

detail_description: The Riga Ghetto and Latvian Holocaust Museum, established in 2010, is a poignant tribute to the history of the Riga ghetto and the Jewish community's plight during World War II. Through outdoor exhibitions, it vividly portrays pre-Holocaust Jewish life in Riga while honoring the memory of those who suffered. The museum features compelling displays including photographs, documents, and personal belongings from the ghetto's residents.
name: Riga Ghetto and Latvian Holocaust Museum
address: Lastādijas iela 14A, Latgales priekšpilsēta, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Built in 1909, this medieval-inspired building is known for its 2 cat sculptures on roof turrets.
detail_description: The Cat House, a medieval-inspired building constructed in 1909, is famous for its two cat sculptures perched on roof turrets. Despite its name, it's not the feline-filled dwelling from the fairy tale but rather an old town house located in Riga's city center. The former owner, a wealthy merchant, adorned the building with black cats as a prank to get back at the Merchant Guild that rejected him.
name: Cat House
address: Meistaru iela 10/12, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Previous KGB headquarters, now home to Museum of the Occupation of Latvia displays.
detail_description: The Corner House in Riga is a seemingly ordinary building in the city center with a dark past. Once the headquarters of the KGB secret police, it now houses the Museum of the Occupation of Latvia. This museum offers visitors a chilling look into the brutal actions of the Soviet enforcers and where political prisoners were held during the city's Soviet control in the 1940s.
name: The Corner House
address: Brīvības iela 61, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1010, Latvia

detail_description: Bar 'Riga Black Magic' is a must-visit spot in Latvia's Old Town, offering the country's national drink, Black Balsam. This traditional herbal liqueur is made from 24 natural ingredients and has a bittersweet taste. The bar's interior exudes an old-world charm with vintage decor and cozy seating, making it a perfect place to enjoy Balsam cocktails and sweet treats.
name: Bar "Riga Black Magic"
address: Kaļķu iela 10, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Sculpture based on a Brothers Grimm story, said to bring good luck if the animals' noses are rubbed.
detail_description: The Bremen Town Musicians sculpture, inspired by a beloved Brothers Grimm fairy tale, is a delightful sight in Riga. This charming monument features a cat, donkey, dog, and rooster stacked atop one another—a symbol of resilience and friendship among aging animals who seek freedom from their mistreatment. Created by Krista Baumgartel in 1990, the statue not only captures the essence of the story but also represents significant historical themes like the end of the Cold War.
name: Town Musicians of Bremen
address: Pēterbaznīcas iela, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Charming market held every Saturday, offering produce, artisanal food & clothing, plus live music.
detail_description: Kalnciema Quarter Market is a charming weekly event held in the wooden architecture quarter of Kalnciema. It's a highlight for Pardaugava residents, offering a variety of goods including produce, artisanal food, and clothing. The market also features live music and creative workshops for children. Latvian farmers and craftsmen showcase their delicious products, many of which are organic.
name: Kalnciema Quarter Market
address: Kalnciema Iela 35, Zemgales priekšpilsēta, Rīga, LV-1046, Latvia

excerpt: Vibrant Vecrīga, the old town, is home to churches like the medieval Riga Cathedral and St. Peter's Church, with a towering steeple. Overlooking the River Daugava, turreted Riga Castle is now the presidential residence, while the ornate red-brick House of the Black Heads exhibits artwork and weapons. Narrow stone streets and broad plazas like Dome Square and Līvu Square are lined with lively restaurants and pubs.
detail_description: Vecrīga, also known as the old town of Riga, is a vibrant area filled with historical and architectural wonders. The medieval Riga Cathedral and St. Peter's Church are just some of the churches that adorn this charming neighborhood. Cobblestone streets wind through Vecrīga, lined with over 500 colorful buildings representing various architectural styles such as Baroque, Gothic, and Art Nouveau.
name: Vecrīga
address: Central District, Riga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Restored clock dating to 1924, serving as local landmark & popular meeting spot.
detail_description: The Laima Clock, a restored timepiece dating back to 1924, is a beloved local landmark and a popular meeting spot in Riga. Situated at the junction of the old town and the pedestrian square, it stands out as one of the city's iconic landmarks. Adjacent to it lies the pedestrian plaza with the Statue of Liberty and picturesque canals on both sides. The area is often adorned with beautiful blooming flowers, adding to its charm.
name: Laima Clock
address: Aspazijas bulvāris 20, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Stalinist-style structure completed in 1961,  including a tower with a 17th-floor observation deck.
detail_description: The Latvian Academy of Sciences, a towering 21-floor office building completed in 1961, boasts a striking Stalinist-style design. Visitors can ascend to the 17th-floor observation deck for breathtaking panoramic views of Riga, including the Old Town and the Daugava River. To gain access to this vantage point, visitors must purchase an entrance ticket.
name: Latvian Academy of Sciences
address: Akadēmijas laukums 1, Latgales priekšpilsēta, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Mežaparks is a neighbourhood of Northern District in Riga, the capital of Latvia. It consists of a residential area to the South and a large urban park to the North of the same name – Mežaparks. The neighbourhood is located on the western shore of Lake Ķīšezers. The name is literally translated as "forest park". Wikipedia.
detail_description: Mežaparks, which translates to "forest park," is a neighborhood in Riga, Latvia. It features a residential area to the south and a large urban park to the north, situated on the western shore of Lake Ķīšezers. The park offers diverse activities such as play areas, outdoor concerts, disc golf, skating and cycling routes, food and drink options, a zoo, water sports on the lake with a beach area, and forested walking paths.
name: Mežaparks
address: Northern District, Riga, Latvia

excerpt: Opened in the 19th century, this 5-hectare park features gardens, a fountain, walking paths & more.
detail_description: Vērmane Garden, a 5-hectare park established in the 19th century, is a top attraction in Riga. It offers beautiful gardens, a fountain, and scenic walking paths. The park is perfect for spending holidays with friends or as a tourist destination. Visitors can enjoy lush greenery, vast open spaces, and picturesque pathways. Nature lovers will find it to be a paradise for relaxation. Additionally, the Raymond Pauls Music Center is located within the garden grounds.
name: Vērmane Garden
address: Tērbatas iela 2D, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Hilly green space with man-made cascades, small bridges, sculptures & a swan house on the canal.
detail_description: Bastejkalna Park is a picturesque green space nestled between Riga's two major canals, featuring man-made cascades, small bridges, and sculptures. Families can enjoy various activities such as strolling along the paths, admiring the ponds, and relaxing in the seating areas. The park offers ample greenery and trees, providing an ideal setting for quality time with kids. Positioned near the Freedom Monument, it offers stunning views of both Old Riga and New Riga.
name: Bastejkalna Park
address: Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: City panoramas from a 17th-floor viewing platform atop a 1961 Stalinist-style building.
detail_description: The Latvian Academy of Sciences Observation Deck offers stunning city panoramas from its 17th-floor viewing platform, situated atop a 1961 Stalinist-style building in the Moscow Suburb to the south of Riga's old city. The observation deck provides a unique perspective, showcasing remnants of centuries-old wooden architecture alongside post-war Soviet monumentalism.
name: Latvian Academy of Sciences Observation deck
address: Akademijas laukums 1, Latgales priekšpilsēta, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

detail_description: Skyline Bar in Riga offers a unique Sunday brunch experience with live music and breathtaking panoramic views. The brunch menu features a wide variety of dishes including salads, starters, fish, meat and cheese appetizers, hot dishes like pizza and soup, as well as an array of desserts such as pancakes, waffles, croissants, eclairs, and more. In the evening, visitors can enjoy craft cocktails while taking in the stunning illuminated cityscape.
name: Skyline bar
address: Elizabetes iela 55, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1010, Latvia

excerpt: Free-admission military history museum in a 14th-c. tower, a remnant of the original city walls.
detail_description: The Latvian War Museum, housed in the historic Powder Tower in Riga, Latvia, offers free admission to visitors interested in exploring the military history of Latvia. The museum's collection includes artifacts and exhibits that cover various periods, from ancient times to the present day. Visitors can learn about key events such as the Latvian War of Independence, World War I and II, and the Soviet occupation.
name: Latvian War Museum
address: Smilšu iela 20, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: 368-m. broadcasting tower with a tripod design, 2 high-speed elevators & an observation deck.
detail_description: Riga Radio and TV Tower is a 368-meter broadcasting tower featuring a unique tripod design, two high-speed elevators, and an observation deck offering panoramic views of the city. Situated on the island of Zakusala on the Daugava River, it stands as one of the tallest structures in Europe. Visitors can reach the observation deck at a height of about 100 meters within seconds using high-speed elevators.
name: Riga Radio and TV Tower
address: Zaķusalas krastmala, Zemgales priekšpilsēta, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

detail_description: The Fashion Museum in Riga is a unique attraction showcasing an extensive collection of costumes, clothing items, and accessories from the renowned fashion collector Aleksander Vassiljev. Located near the House of the Black Heads on a historically rich street, the museum's three halls offer insights into centuries-old history. The displays are refreshed every six months and feature audio and video materials that bring different fashion eras to life.
name: Fashion Museum in Riga
address: Grēcinieku iela 24-1, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: University botanical garden with an arboretum, plus a huge palm house & tropical butterflies.
detail_description: The University of Latvia Botanical Garden in Riga is a stunning destination featuring an arboretum, a palm house, and tropical butterflies. The garden comes alive in late spring with vibrant rhododendron blossoms creating a colorful environment. Visitors can explore the Azalea house and butterfly house, which offer breathtaking displays of color and variety. Despite some areas under construction or temporarily closed, the garden offers plenty to see outside, especially during July when it's at its most colorful.
name: University of Latvia Botanical Garden
address: Kandavas iela 2, Kurzemes rajons, Rīga, LV-1083, Latvia

detail_description: The Latvian National Theatre, located in Riga, is a modern and historically significant institution with a rich 100-year-old tradition. The eclectic-style building holds great historical importance as it was the site where Latvia declared its independence in 1918. With three auditoriums accommodating between 70 to 700 spectators, the theatre continues to be a prominent cultural hub. Its Neo-Baroque architecture adds to its charm and serves as a reminder of Latvia's past.
name: Latvian National Theatre
address: Kronvalda bulvāris 2, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1010, Latvia

detail_description: Riga Old Evangelical Lutheran Church of St. Gertrude is a stunning Neo-Gothic church located outside the city's defensive walls. Dedicated to Saint Gertrude, the patron saint of travelers, this fairytale-like church stands out amidst the modern city center. Its magnificent Eclectic and Neo-Gothic architecture makes it one of the few historic churches outside the Old Town.
name: Riga Old Evangelical Lutheran Church of St. Gertrude
address: Ģertrūdes iela 8, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1010, Latvia

detail_description: Riga Brethren Cemetery, also known as Brāļu Kapi, holds great historical significance as the central military cemetery of Latvian forces since 1915. It is the resting place for over 3000 Latvian heroes who sacrificed their lives for the country's independence after WWI.
name: Riga Brethren Cemetery
address: Aizsaules iela 1B, Ziemeļu rajons, Rīga, LV-1026, Latvia

detail_description: Roland's Statue is a must-visit in Riga, standing in front of the palace and offering historical significance. At night, the surrounding buildings are illuminated, creating a beautiful ambiance around this pretty statue with a drinking water fountain. It's a great spot to enjoy the scenery and take in some history while quenching your thirst.
name: Roland's Statue
address: Rātslaukums, Centra rajons, Rīga, 1050, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Long-standing military history museum housed in a centuries-old fortification tower.
detail_description: The Powder Tower in Riga is a historic military museum housed within a well-preserved ancient fortification tower. Dating back to the 14th century, it is the last remaining of 18 towers that once defended the city. Originally known as Sand Tower, it was later renamed for its role in safeguarding gunpowder. Despite being partially destroyed and rebuilt over the centuries, it stands as a testament to Riga's ancient defenses.
name: Powder Tower
address: Smilšu iela 20, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

detail_description: Ķīpsala is a picturesque neighborhood in Riga, known for its renovated wooden houses and cobblestoned streets along the river. It offers superb panoramic views of the Old Town and Citadele area, making it a desirable real estate location. The area is popular among students attending Riga Technical University due to its proximity and quality student dormitories.
name: Ķīpsala
address: Kurzeme District, Riga, LV-1048, Latvia

excerpt: Hip, subterranean hangout with Latvian pub fare, lots of beer & concerts in an ancient wine cellar.
detail_description: Ala Pagrabs is a popular underground tavern in Riga's Old Town, offering a wide selection of Latvian beers, contemporary local cuisine, and live music. This subterranean hangout is housed in an ancient wine cellar and is beloved by both locals and tourists. The venue stays open until 6am, making it a great spot for dinner and late-night drinks.
name: Ala Pagrabs
address: Peldu iela 19, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

detail_description: Dome Square is a captivating city square in Riga, located beneath the impressive Riga Cathedral. The medieval cathedral's beautiful brickwork is a sight to behold, while the square itself boasts other attractions such as the Art Museum Riga Bourse and various government buildings with striking architecture. Doma Cathedral, almost as old as the city of Riga, serves as its spiritual heart.
name: Dome Square
address: Doma laukums, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

detail_description: When visiting Riga, make sure to prioritize a visit to the Old Town Estate SIA. This historic center is a UNESCO World Heritage site and is filled with narrow streets and architectural wonders that are perfect for photo opportunities. Additionally, the area boasts some of the best bars and restaurants where you can savor traditional Latvian cuisine. The knowledgeable staff at Old Town Estate SIA will ensure you have a great time exploring this wonderful city.
name: OLD TOWN ESTATE SIA
address: Ernesta Birznieka-Upīša iela 20a, Latgales priekšpilsēta, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

detail_description: The Žanis Lipke Memorial is a modern, interactive museum located on the island of Kipsala. It pays tribute to Žanis Lipke and a group of around 25 individuals who risked their lives to save Jews from the Nazis during Latvia's occupation. The museum is situated on the land where Lipke once hid people in a bunker, and it showcases his courageous efforts alongside others in helping Jews escape local ghettos and finding refuge across the country.
name: Žanis Lipke Memorial
address: Mazais Balasta dambis 9, Kurzemes rajons, Rīga, LV-1048, Latvia

excerpt: Built in 1901, this landmark route is celebrated for the art nouveau buildings that line both sides.
detail_description: Alberta Iela, also known as Albert Street, is a must-see landmark in Riga, Latvia. This historic route is famous for its stunning art nouveau buildings that were constructed between 1901 and 1908. The street is named after Bishop Albert von Buxthoeven, the founder of Riga.
name: Alberta iela
address: Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1010, Latvia

detail_description: Jauniela, a charming street in the old part of Riga, is known for its picturesque setting and cinematic appeal. Measuring just 225 meters long, it has been featured in various films as a stand-in for European streets. Notable appearances include portraying London's Baker Street in 'The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson' and Flower Street in 'Seventeen Moments of Spring.'
name: Jauniela
address: Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: 17th-century gate in a remaining portion of the city's medieval fortification walls.
detail_description: Zviedru vārti, a 17th-century gate located in a remaining portion of the city's medieval fortification walls, is a genius piece of city planning by the Swedes. The existing but redundant city walls were repurposed as part of buildings, creating surprisingly thick walls that separate rooms. To facilitate access to the city, the Swedes built a tunnel.
name: Swedish Gate
address: Torņa iela 4-1a, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

detail_description: The Armoury Bar, located in the heart of the city, is a themed bar known for its extensive selection of beers and whiskey. The venue features decommissioned firearms as part of its decor, offering unique photo opportunities for visitors. Situated near the city's cathedral, it remains open until the early hours of the morning throughout the week. The dimly lit space showcases firearms and ammunition while offering a variety of local craft beers and brews from around the world.
name: The Armoury Bar
address: Vecpilsētas iela 11, Centra rajons, Rīga, LV-1050, Latvia

excerpt: Riverside Latgale Suburb is home to the Spīķeri quarter, with a plaza for flea markets and concerts fringed by 1800s warehouses, and to Riga Central Market, with produce stalls and a global food court. Jewish history is commemorated at sites like the Great Choral Synagogue Holocaust Monument, on the ruins of a temple destroyed in 1941. Another memorial, to a 1905 Russian massacre, sits in leafy Grīziņkalna Park.
name: Latgale Suburb
address: Riga, Latvia
